cons: Poor communication, at times, between unit and office.

pros: Mileage is reimbursed at a decent rate
cons: The cutbacks are taking their toll

job_title: Certified Home Health Aide in Dover, NJ
pros:
Provided travel reimbursement, uniform scrub tops, and medical supplies. 
The opportunity to create meaningful relationships with patients and families. 
My personal experience with PCCs and management was over all pleasant.  They were accommodating when I requested changes to my schedule for personal reasons.
cons:
No room for growth and no raises available for CHHAs. 
From what I could tell they over worked their full time employees since the CHHAs are always understaffed. Read your employment policy carefully and don't be afraid to enforce it.

pros:
Can be Very team oriented depending on your department.  
Decent benefits.
Comp time if holidays or weekends are worked (you WILL work plenty of them)
cons:
Not much of a work-life balance and very poor morale
Management doesn't seem to know what they are doing, make way too much money to not know how to do their job.
Puts an overload of work on all employees, so most end up being overly stressed and overly unhappy
Too concerned with money for a "non-profit" company as they advertise themselves to be.
Misuse of certain funds given to them, makes you feel bad as an employee doing what they do.

pros: As a new graduate nurse, the VNA has provided exceptional training & mentorship.  It is a wonderful environment for beginner nurses to gain clinical knowledge and experience.  The VNA also provides internal growth opportunities to facilitate advancement in the company.  Truly a wonderful place to work!
cons: I worried starting my career in homecare as a new nurse, however, the VNA's mentorship program made me feel comfortable and confident in my skills and ability to be in homecare.

pros: Great benefits and good physical work environment and town in which located.  Coworkers were team oriented, friendly and believe in the mission of the organization.
cons: Senior management does not understand the business and make poor decisions.  Poor communication with employees and unfair practices internally regarding salaries and promotions.

pros: Good support from immediate supervisors, but large disconnect between upper management and field staff. Great benefits. Flexible hours depending on how you structure your day.
cons: Limited side-by-side experience for new employees and graduates. Work is independent. Schedule fluctuates frequently throughout the day and appointments are scheduled either the night before or morning of visits.

pros: Fellow colleagues work hard and do everything they can for their clients and co-workers.    Patients are the best.
cons: Management is very hands off.  Not in touch with day to day challenges of staff.

pros: Friendly and team oriented environment, room for growth opportunities and excellent technology systems!
cons: Nothing negative to say at this time.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Morristown, NJ
pros: Make your own schedule up each day, you are in control of your day as long as there are no emergencies
cons: heavy case load, especially when another nurse resigns, management throws cases to other nurses.  Poor management.

pros: They have a good benefits package

job_title: On Call RN in Morristown, NJ
cons: Mobile sweatshop. No respect for field staff
